snippet: The state Deutsche Bank and other financial institutions in Europe is crucial for the economy because European companies are more dependent on bank credit than American businesses.
abstract: News analysis; Germany's Deutsche Bank reports surprise fourth-quarter loss of 965 million euros, or $1.3 billion; bank and other financial institutions in Europe are crucial for the economy because European companies are more dependent on bank credit than American businesses.
lead_paragraph: The state Deutsche Bank and other financial institutions in Europe is crucial for the economy because European companies are more dependent on bank credit than American businesses.

headline.main: Deutsche Loss Underlines European Economy’s Dependence on Banks
headline.print_headline: Deutsche Loss Underlines European Economy’s Dependence on Banks
